content: Pushing for an “ Office of Public Participation” is the right path. Here in Colorado the investor owned (greed driven) utility, XCEL, employs ~40 high paid laywers to try to get the PUC (Public Utility Commission) to decide rate cases and new investment in their favor. Trying to give counter balance are tiny organisations with one or two people, plus the occasional pro bono lawyer. Not fair. There used to be a financial mechanism to provide funds for organisations providing the public interest, but not any more.
